oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original edition of the congressional Report on Fort Pillow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: May 1864 edition of the Congressional "Reports of the Committee on the Conduct of the War, Fort Pillow Massacre. Returned Prisoners." The US Congress was beginning to be dominated by Radical Republicans by 1864, and they used the massacre at Fort Pillow to push congressional policy toward greater military protection for black freedmen and support for the United States Colored troops (USCT).
